job_title: Patient Access Coordinator in Valdosta, GA
pros: Benefits are reasonable in cost.
cons: They usually find a way to fire their long term employees. I worked there for 4 years and they used a write up from the year prior to fire me. I filed for an appeal and never got a response. By no means does this company have your back as a loyal employee. Don’t waste your time.  There is no appreciation for working there. They used a write up from Jan 2021 to fire me after 4 years of employment. Sad to say the best thing about this company is the $25 gift card we get for Christmas every year. Makes you feel extra appreciated.

job_title: Executive Director RN in Valdosta, GA
pros: ED has a strict ratio, we only go up when the RN offers. RNs only offer because we felt supported and genuinely want what was best for patients. SGMC is aware of the need for nurses and has utilized travel RNs appropriately to prevent core staff burnout.
cons: Pay is not the greatest, but that is just part of being in south GA. It is however competitive for the area. High acuity, and high volumes.

job_title: PAS Representative I in Valdosta, GA
pros: Depending on the department you work in, your schedule is flexible. The company likes to give staff freebies like pizza, paying for food trucks, etc.
cons: The hospital likes to give employees free food every other month, but when it’s required for staff to purchase new uniforms (and they must be purchased directly through the hospital) they inflate prices about 30% more than what other local stores charge. The pay for this position is terrible. Most PAS positions require 12 hour shifts and that gets old real fast. If you’re lucky enough to get a PAS position outside of ER & Urgent care, it’s not as bad.

job_title: clinical and non clinical positions in Valdosta, GA
pros: Nice new water fountain, Nice new heart tower, Nice new admissions entrance, New poorly built parking garage. Surgery center is nice. What about working there???? Hmmmm.... Nothing nice about that!
cons:
TOP REASONS NOT TO WORK AT SGMC!

-Heavy-Handed Top-Down Leadership
-Fear Driven leadership
-Benefits/healthcare coverage less than par
-Little consideration for long time hard working employees.
-Petty on-the-spot policies to micro manage staff
-Under the table behavior modification
-Superficial non-relational leaders 
-Lack of employee rewards based incentives
-Promotes Lower staff to patient ratio during low census and degrades patient care
-Overworks clinical and nonclinical staff with no relief or compensation
-More concern given to keeping up appearances than quality patient and employee care
(Top box % is key not Top employees %)

-Top 10 of nations highest priced healthcare costs
(Although upper management will state they are the lowest priced in region)

review_title: A Job with decent Benefits an Administration (Hospital wide) that can't manage money well
job_title: Pharmacy Tech III in Valdosta, GA
pros: The Benefits are great, the people are wonderful (with a few grumpy folks).  the Pharmacy Administration is very caring and very particular, they will work with you if your kiddos are sick, or if you are sick.
cons: Pay is horrible, they said they compared us to regional hospitals, however when you have a Bachelor's Degree, Certified and Registered and only get paid 11.00 / hr its pretty ridiculous. Upper level adminitration doesn't know how to handle / manage money. They are constantly building and buying other hospitals.. Which adds to the workload yet no raises or no new people are being hired to take care of new patients.. Patient care / satisfaction is horrible probably because employee moral is bad. Overall this is a great place to work if you like to Kiss Up and Brown nose you will go far.. I always just put my head down and work my tail off to earn my keep.

pros: I loved SGMC as a new grad RN. I had been an LPN for many years and bridged over to RN. I worked in the ED night weekends and worked with some of the best crew around.  We had great teamwork, communication and it felt like family there.  I loved we always had pot luck dinners, celebrated birthdays, weddings and other special events as a group. No clicks at all and everyone treated each other fair and like you were part of the 'gang'.  The patient care was top notch and everyone knew their stuff when the *** hit the fan.
cons: None I can think of.

job_title: Safety Sitter I in Valdosta, GA
pros: The job is PRN (as needed), so you get to make your own schedule. Plus, they are always asking for safety sitters to work extra hours. It's the perfect job for a college student.
cons: Sometimes, either the charge nurse or the admin coordinator will not tell you that no one is going to relieve you after your shift is completed. So you'll end up sitting with a patient well after your shift is over until you speak up. This usually happens during the weekend shifts.

pros: Wonderful new-employee orientation.  Great schedule.
cons: Due to short-staffing, I have spent many 12 hour shifts with no break or lunch. (12 hours is a long time to go without food.)

pros: Passionate nurses, physicians and medical personnel striving for good quality patient care.  Staff within the background, billing, collections, denials are truly a major cornerstone of SGMC.
cons: Upper level management miscommunication, contract employees in high leadership roles.  Main hospital and PFS not on same page.  Nonsupportive to the main goal.  Taking care of the patient and doing what is right and honest.

pros: The hospital is willing to teach you everything you need to know about a position. The training is AMAZING!!! If you are in college they will work with your schedule.
cons: They are always in need of help! You will constantly get pulled to other floors because they need help all over the hospital.

review_title: The organization feeds off of its employees rather than building them up and protecting them!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Valdosta, GA
pros: SGMC’s ONLY - (PRO) “If you could call that“  would have to be it’s vicinity, and that’s only if you live in the area. If you don’t live in the area it’s not worth driving to
cons:
1. Management does not have your back! They are much too concerned with their own back’s!
2. Salaries for almost every position in the hospital are substandard! When you take the same positions and compare them with neighboring hospitals in the northern part of the state or even just in middle Georgia you’ll find that the hourly rate is severely off balance. Discussing your pay rate with your coworker is an offense that is punishable by termination, that’s how secretive they want the fact that they are cheating their employees kept a secret!
3. This facility cares nothing about seeing your a T. New management that is been brought in in recent years feels that the older employees are a weight and burden that the facility must eliminate in order to grow and prosper. They don’t take into consideration the fact that these senior employees are the backbone of the facility and are the ones that built SGMC into what once was a great place to receive quality, patient centered care, And it was a great place to work even though they never quite could get the salary situation taken care of.
4. Job security doesn’t exist! Example: if someone in upper management such as a department director or supervisor does not like you or for whatever reason feels that you don’t fit in the organization the way they think you should fit into the organization they will work tirelessly to remove you from the organization.  They will take policies and procedures and twist and turn and burn them to create whatever is necessary to scrape you off of SGMC’s payroll. So again JOB SECURITY does not exist at South Georgia Medical Center.
I could go on and on, but if after reading these four points you still feel that SGMC SOUTHSIDE place for you to work then by all means fill out the application and then full steam ahead. But you can’t say you weren’t warned

pros: Really enjoyed the environment and the staff. The management was easy to work with and for, and the benefits were perfect.
